radiographic_examinations.findings: The bases of lungs are clear. Note is made of a small right Bochdalek hernia. The liver is normal without evidence of focal lesions, or intrahepatic biliary ductal dilatation. Mild periportal edema, likely secondary to over hydration. The gallbladder is normal. The spleen is homogeneous, and normal in size. The adrenal glands bilaterally are normal. The kidneys bilaterally are normal without evidence of focal solid or cystic lesions concerning for malignancy. There is no evidence of hydronephrosis. The pancreas is normal without pancreatic ductal dilatation. The stomach, duodenum, and small bowel are normal without evidence of wall thickening, or obstruction. Note is made of a small hiatal hernia. There is no retroperitoneal, or mesenteric lymphadenopathy. There is no intra-abdominal free air, or free fluid. The appendix is dilated, measuring 1.1 cm, with mild surrounding fat stranding concerning for acute appendicitis. The urinary bladder is normal. There is no pelvic wall, or inguinal lymphadenopathy. There is no pelvic free fluid. The prostate is enlarged, measuring up to 6.7 cm. The celiac, SMA, and other major vessels are unremarkable. There is no evidence of an abdominal aneurysm. Moderate atherosclerotic disease is seen. There is normal conventional hepatic arterial anatomy. There is no evidence of an active GI bleed. Degenerative changes are seen within the hips bilaterally. No focal lytic or sclerotic lesions concerning for malignancy are identified. Moderate degenerative changes throughout the thoracolumbar spine.
